title: How To Make an HTML Book

content.text: How TO - Make an HTML Book
Learn how to create an HTML Book that will work on all devices, PC, laptop, tablet, and phone.
content.html: Learn how to create an HTML Book that will work on all devices, PC, laptop, tablet, and phone.

content.text: First, Create a Basic HTML Page
HTML is the standard markup language for creating websites and CSS is the language that describes the style of an HTML document.
content.html: HTML is the standard markup language for creating websites and CSS is the language that describes the style of an HTML document.

content.text: We will combine HTML and CSS to create a basic HTML Book.
content.html: We will combine HTML and CSS to create a basic HTML Book.

content.text: First start with an HTML skeleton:

content.code:
My Book

HTML book created by me.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<head>
<title>My Book</title>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
</head>

<body>
<h1>My Book</h1>
<p>HTML book created by me.</p>
</body>

</html>

content.text: Example Explained
The code explained above are HTML tags.
content.html: The code explained above are HTML tags.

content.text: HTML tags are used to define the content of an HTML dokument.
content.html: HTML tags are used to define the content of an HTML dokument.

content.text: The tags start with a < (less-than sign) and end witn a > (greater-than sign).
content.html: The tags start with a < (less-than sign) and end witn a > (greater-than sign).

content.text:
This way

and

are used to mark up the beginning and the end of a paragraph.
content.html: This way <p> and </p> are used to mark up the beginning and the end of a paragraph.

content.text: Note: If you want to study HTML in detail, please read our HTML Tutorial .
content.html: Note: If you want to study HTML in detail, please read our HTML Tutorial.

content.text: To be fully correct, there should be a language attribute added to the <html> tag to define the language used in the book:
content.html: To be fully correct, there should be a language attribute added to the <html> tag to define the language used in the book:

content.code_html: <html lang="en">

content.text: Adding the following meta information will make your book display correctly on all devices, PC, laptop, tablet, and phone:
content.html: Adding the following meta information will make your book display correctly on all devices, PC, laptop, tablet, and phone:

content.code_html: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">

content.code:
My Book

HTML book created by me.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
<title>My Book</title>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
</head>

<body>
<h1>My Book</h1>
<p>HTML book created by me.</p>
</body>

</html>

content.text: Create a Table of Content
Inside the <body> </body> elements, add a table of content:
content.html: Inside the <body> </body> elements, add a table of content:

content.code:
Philosopy

Table of Contents

1. Metaphysics

2. Epistemology

3. Logics

4. Ethics

5. Aesthetics
content.code_html:
<body>

<h1>Philosopy</h1>
<h3>Table of Contents</h3>

<p>1. Metaphysics</p>
<p>2. Epistemology</p>
<p>3. Logics</p>
<p>4. Ethics</p>
<p>5. Aesthetics</p>

</body>

content.text: Add a Some Style
Add a styleheet to your book:

content.code_html: <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/w3css/4/w3.css">

content.text: Note: If you want to study CSS in detail, please read Our CSS Tutorial .
content.html: Note: If you want to study CSS in detail, please read Our CSS Tutorial.

content.text: Create an HTML page for Chapter 1

content.code:
1. Metaphysics

The nature of reality.

Metaphysics is the part of philosophy that studies the nature of reality.

When we look around, we can see:

  • Nature
  • Animals
  • People
  • Houses
  • Cars
  • and much more

Is this Virtual Reality real?

In Metaphysics, the questions is:

  • What is real?
  • Is what we see real?
  • Is there more than we see?
  • Is there more than we sence?
  • Is there something else?
  • Is there something more?
  • Is there another dimension?
content.code_html:
<body class="w3-content">
<div class="w3-container">

<h1>1. Metaphysics</h1>

<h3>The nature of reality.</h3>

<p>Metaphysics is the part of philosophy that studies the nature of reality.</p>

<p>When we look around, we can see:</p>
<ul>
<li>Nature</li>
<li>Animals</li>
<li>People</li>
<li>Houses</li>
<li>Cars</li>
<li>and much more</li>
</ul>

<p>Is this Virtual Reality real?</p>

<p>In Metaphysics, the questions is:</p>
<ul>
<li>What is real?</li>
<li>Is what we see real?</li>
<li>Is there more than we see?</li>
<li>Is there more than we sence?</li>
<li>Is there something else?</li>
<li>Is there something more?</li>
<li>Is there another dimension?</li>
</ul>
</div>

</body>

content.text: Add a Link to Chapter 1

content.code:
Philosopy

Table of Contents

1. Metaphysics

2. Epistemology

3. Logics

4. Ethics

5. Aesthetics
content.code_html:
<body>

<h1>Philosopy</h1>
<h3>Table of Contents</h3>

<p><a href="philosophy_chapter1.htm">1. Metaphysics</a></p>
<p>2. Epistemology</p>
<p>3. Logics</p>
<p>4. Ethics</p>
<p>5. Aesthetics</p>

</body>

content.text: In the example above, we named the first chapter of the book:
content.html: In the example above, we named the first chapter of the book:

content.text: " philosophy_chapter1.htm ".
The name to use is up to you. Maybe it should be called "Metaphysics".
content.html: The name to use is up to you. Maybe it should be called "Metaphysics".

content.text: Anyway, continue as above and create the other chapters:
content.html: Anyway, continue as above and create the other chapters:

content.text: "philosophy_chaper2.htm" "philosophy_chaper3.htm" "philosophy_chaper4.htm" "philosophy_chaper5.htm"
Add a Link to Each Chapter

content.code:
Philosopy

Table of Contents

1. Metaphysics

2. Epistemology

3. Logics

4. Ethics

5. Aesthetics
content.code_html:
<body>

<h1>Philosopy</h1>
<h3>Table of Contents</h3>

<p>
<a href="philosophy_chapter1.htm">1. Metaphysics</a>
</p>

<p>
<a href="philosophy_chapter2.htm">2. Epistemology</a>
</p>

<p>
<a href="philosophy_chapter3.htm">3. Logics</a>
</p>

<p>
<a href="philosophy_chapter5.htm">4. Ethics</a>
</p>

<p>
<a href="philosophy_chapter4.htm">5. Aesthetics</a>
</p>

</body>
